intro: Hiraea bunchosioides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hiraea, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically pale yellow to white, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Hiraea bunchosioides is often found in dry, open habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens.
